description: Construction of a single storey detached three bed four person dwellinghouse in rear garden; with associated amenity space; car parking space; cycle and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers:  A101; A102; A103 dated 25/07/2019; A104 dated 25/07/2019; A105 25/07/2019; A106 dated 25/07/2019; A107 25/07/2019; A108 dated 25/07/2019

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | External materials to be used in the development shall include black aluminium window frames and a dark multi-brick for the rear elevation. All other materials, as labelled on the approved plans, shall comprise larch external cladding to the front and sides of the house and a sedum planted roof.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 5.11, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall be fixed shut and retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To minimise interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers within the rear garden setting and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A  and C to F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 and to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no extensions or works as specified in the stated classed shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Furthermore, at no time shall the new house be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).	 | Prior to first occupation of the new house, an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh shall be installed and thereafter permanently retained

Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the approved plans, further details of the proposed permeable hard standing and biodiverse soft landscaping, including details of the boundary treatments and means of enclosure (including fences, gates, trees, planted screening) for the proposed development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation of the development.  All detailed works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of the premises.
Any soft landscaping, including trees which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced within the next planting season.

Reason:  To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development  in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016), the London Environment strategy (2018) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | A single car parking space for use by the occupants of the development shall be provided as shown on the approved plan with defined points of access to the shared forecourt. The parking space shall be kept unobstructed for the safe entry and exit of a vehicle at all times; and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure off-street parking does not prejudice pedestrian or highway safety and to ensure that the development does not result in an increased demand for parking that cannot be safely met within the locality of the site in compliance with London Plan (2016) policy 6.1.
| At least 4 secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site and shall be retained thereafter.
Reason: to encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2016) policy 6.9
| Waste and recycling storage facilities to accommodate at least 2x 240L bins for recycling and non-recycling shall be provided and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
